quotes.quote: There are horrors beyond life’s edge that we do not suspect, and once in a while man’s evil prying calls them just within our range.
There is no terror in the bang, only in the anticipation of it.
Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.
The shortest horror story:  The last man on Earth sat alone in a room. There was a knock on the door.
Horror is the natural reaction to the last 5,000 years of history.
It is a mistake to fancy that horror is associated inextricably with darkness, silence, and solitude.
When you look fear in the face, you are able to say to yourself, 'I lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.'
No new horror can be more terrible than the daily torture of the commonplace.
Life is absolutely horrific, leading up to absolute horror.
Death holds no horrors. It is simply the ultimate horror of life.
There is a mystery about this which stimulates the imagination; where there is no imagination there is no horror.
From even the greatest of horrors irony is seldom absent.
The greatest horrors of our world are committed by people who are totally sincere.
Horror was rooted in sympathy . . . in understanding what it would be like to suffer the worst.
Horror in your country is something you take a dose of to remind yourself that you are not suffering from it.
The charm of horror only tempts the strong.
Horror is the removal of masks.
Broad daylight does not encourage the apprehension of horror.
The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown
Horror is beyond the reach of psychology.
People want to be disturbed when they go see a horror movie.
Danger doesn’t lurk at every corner. It’s just hanging out, waiting for fear and horror to show up.
Horror movies don't exist unless you go and see them, and people always will.
The basis of all true cosmic horror is violation of the order of nature, and the profoundest violations are always the least concrete and describable.
